name: RunCloudRuntimeUnitTest
friendlyName: Execute Unit Tests in Unified Environment
description: Execute set of unit tests in Unified Environment scenario.
author: Microsoft Corporation
helpMarkDown: Review the Dynamics 365 for Finance and Operations [Developer Documentation](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/dev-tools/hosted-build-automation), [UDE Documentation](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-platform/developer/unified-experience/finance-operations-pipelines).
instanceNameFormat: Execute Unit Tests in Unified Environment

inputs.name: PowerPlatformEnvironment
inputs.label: Connection string
inputs.helpMarkDown: Authenticate with your Power Platform environment connection string. This information can be retrieved from including the [Power Platform Set Connection Variables](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-platform/alm/devops-build-tool-tasks#power-platform-set-connection-variables) task. This task does not support MFA for Username/Password connection and will cause task to timeout.

inputs.name: CloudPackagePlatVersion
inputs.label: Package Platform Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: The platform version of the unified environment.

inputs.name: CloudPackageAppVersion
inputs.label: Package Application Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: The application version of the unified environment.

inputs.name: PlatformPath
inputs.label: Platform Package Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: On hosted agents this should be the root path where the platform NuGet was installed

inputs.name: CompilerPath
inputs.label: X++ Tools Path
inputs.helpMarkDown: On a VM this will be the bin folder in the PackagesLocalDirectory, on hosted agents this should be the path where the compiler NuGet was installed

inputs.name: XppBinariesPath
inputs.label: Location of the X++ modules to test
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the X++ binaries that should be searched, or the default path for the search pattern

inputs.name: XppBinariesSearch
inputs.label: Search patterns for the X++ modules to test
inputs.helpMarkDown: Optional search pattern for the packages to include from the binaries location. Wildcards can be used, or a list of packages by specifying one package name per line.

inputs.name: ReferencePaths
inputs.label: Reference folders containing assemblies the test models depend on
inputs.helpMarkDown: Semi-colon separated list of directories containing reference model folders with assemblies that the current model depends on. Typically build output like $(Build.BinariesDirectory) or any reference folder used in the build step.
